description: The tendency to pay attention to some things while simultaneously ignoring others.
Making decisions based on the information that comes to mind most easily.
The tendency to do (or believe) things because many other people do (or believe) the same.
The tendency to search for, interpret, and remember information in a way that confirms one's preexisting beliefs.
When people with low ability at a task overestimate their ability.
The tendency to attribute others' actions to their character while attributing one's own behavior to external situational factors.
The inclination to see events as having been predictable after they have already occurred.
The common habit of a person taking credit for positive events or outcomes, but blaming outside factors for negative events.
The tendency to rely too heavily on the first piece of information encountered (the 'anchor') when making decisions.
Drawing different conclusions from the same information, depending on how that information is presented.
